quote.quotepara: Attached is a launch configuration for the Hello sample that runs entirely from Eclipse projects, without using any jars. This gives you the "instant change and debug" effect you are looking for. You'll need to hand-edit it a little to fix some hardcoded stuff.

- it explicitly refers to "gwt-windows"; search replace for your platform - the system propert "gwt.devjar" points at a location on my hard drive; you need to point it at a recent real installation of GWT (say, 1.3.3) or else your build/staging directory. The only thing this is used for is where to load native libs (GWT and SWT) from
The second attachment is a web mode JUnit test. Same caveats apply. To unit test in hosted mode remove the "-web" from "gwt.args".
To use these, just drop them into the top level folder of the Eclipse project they belong to (ie, drop Hello.launch into trunk/eclipse/samples/Hello).
